auth.signintoaccess: Sign in to access your automation platform
auth.demoCredentialsWarning: ⚠️ You will be required to change this password on first login

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.subtitle: Manage your hierarchical project folders
dashboard.buildAgentsDesc: Manage and monitor your build agents. View agent status, capabilities, and job history.
dashboard.failedProjectsDesc: Projects where latest build failed. View logs and quickly rebuild.
dashboard.systemMetricsDesc: Monitor server performance, agent metrics, and build statistics in real-time.
dashboard.adminPanelDesc: System settings, environment variables, security configuration, and user management.
dashboard.noFolders: No folders yet. Create your first folder!

folder.name: Folder Name
folder.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete
folder.deleteWarning: This will also delete all folders and projects inside this folder. This action cannot be undone.
folder.moveDesc: Moving "{name}" to a new location. All contents will move with the folder.

browse.title: Browse Folders
browse.noItemsDesc: Get started by creating a new folder or project.

project.name: Project Name
project.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the
project.deleteWarning: This will also delete all projects and subfolders within it.
project.moveFolderDesc: All contents will move with the folder.

access.title: Access Settings
access.owner: Owner Only - Only creator can access
access.groups: Groups - Only specified groups can access
access.noGroups: No groups available. Groups are created from user LDAP memberships or manual assignment.

changePassword.title: Password Change Required
changePassword.subtitle: For security reasons, you must change your password before continuing.
changePassword.requirement2: Cannot be same as current password
changePassword.passwordTooShort: Password must be at least 8 characters

failures.title: Failed Projects
failures.subtitle: Projects where the latest build failed
failures.allProjectsPassingDesc: Excellent! All projects' latest builds are successful.
failures.buildFailed: Build failed - see logs for details
failures.failedToParseWorkflow: Failed to parse project workflow data

agents.title: Build Agents
agents.subtitle: Manage and monitor your build agents. Agents execute your pipeline jobs on distributed machines.
agents.noAgentsDesc: Get started by clicking "Add Agent" above to create your first build agent.
agents.agentCreatedDesc: Your agent has been created. Use this token to connect your agent to the server:
agents.tokenWarning: Save this token securely. You won't be able to see it again. The agent will use this token to authenticate with the server.
agents.deleteAgentConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete agent "{name}"? This action cannot be undone.
agents.failedToCreateAgent: Failed to create agent. Please try again.
agents.failedToUpdateAgent: Failed to update agent. Please try again.

metrics.title: System Metrics
metrics.subtitle: Monitor server, agent, and build performance

credentials.noCredentialsBound: No credentials bound to this node
credentials.helpText: Credentials will be injected as environment variables during job execution.

metricsAgents.deletedCount: Deleted {count} metric records for this agent

metricsAlerts.agentDisconnected: Agent has disconnected or timed out

metricsServer.memoryUsageSystemVsProcess: Memory Usage MB / System vs Process

editorDeleteModal.areYouSureDelete: Are you sure you want to delete the following

editorRetentionModal.configureRetention: Configure how long builds and logs are kept for this project.
editorRetentionModal.olderBuildsDeleted: Older builds will be automatically deleted
editorRetentionModal.buildLogsDeleted: Build logs older than this will be deleted

parameterInputModal.noParametersFound: No parameters found in this project
parameterInputModal.selectValues: Select values to include in this build
parameterInputModal.noValuesInArray: No values defined in array parameter

apiRequestProperties.makeHttpRequests: Make HTTP requests to external APIs. Response data is available via the Output socket.
apiRequestProperties.apiEndpointUrl: The API endpoint URL. Supports parameter placeholders like ${'{INPUT_1}'}
apiRequestProperties.addCustomHeaders: Add custom HTTP headers. Supports parameter placeholders.
apiRequestProperties.requestBodyHelp: Request body (JSON or plain text). Supports parameter placeholders like $INPUT_1
apiRequestProperties.timeoutHelp: Maximum time to wait for response (default: 30 seconds)
apiRequestProperties.successSocket: Success Socket: Triggered on HTTP 2xx status codes (200-299)
apiRequestProperties.failureSocket: Failure Socket: Triggered on errors or non-2xx status codes
apiRequestProperties.usePlaceholders: Use these in URL, headers, or body to pass data from connected nodes

arrayParamProperties.eachLineElement: Each line will become an array element. Empty lines are ignored.
arrayParamProperties.connectParameter: Connect this parameter to a Parallel Matrix node's array input
arrayParamProperties.provideArrayValues: At execution time, provide the array values (or use defaults)
arrayParamProperties.matrixNodeExecute: The matrix node will execute once for each array item
arrayParamProperties.chooseFormat: Choose JSON format for complex objects, or line-separated for simple strings

conditionalProperties.conditionHelp: Write JavaScript condition using input socket variables. If the condition evaluates to true, the green execution socket is used; if false, the red execution socket is used.

cronProperties.cronHelp: Enter a cron expression. Format: minute hour day month dayOfWeek

dependencyNodeProperties.fileContentHelp: Will be written to {fileName} before execution
dependencyNodeProperties.existingFileWarning: Will use existing {fileName} from working directory. Ensure file exists in repository or previous build step.

gitCheckoutProperties.checkoutDirectoryHelp: Directory will be created if it doesn't exist
gitCheckoutProperties.shallowClone: Shallow clone (depth=1, faster for large repos)
gitCheckoutProperties.timeoutHelp: Maximum time to wait for git operations to complete

jobTriggerProperties.sourceProjectHelp: Select which project's completion will trigger this workflow
jobTriggerProperties.triggerConditionHelp: When should this workflow be triggered?

npmInstallProperties.packageJsonHelp: Will be written to package.json before installation
npmInstallProperties.existingFileWarning: Will use existing package.json from working directory. Ensure file exists in repository or previous build step.

parallelBranchesProperties.branchesHelp: Each branch creates an execution socket to connect parallel execution nodes
parallelBranchesProperties.maxConcurrencyHelp: Leave empty for unlimited parallel execution
parallelBranchesProperties.failFastHelp: Stop all branches if any branch fails

parallelExecutionProperties.parallelExecutionDescription: This node is designed to be connected to a Parallel Branches node. It has no output sockets - all results are sent back to the parent parallel node.

parallelMatrixProperties.connectToArrayValues: Connect it to this node's Array Values input socket
parallelMatrixProperties.arrayValuesUsage: The array values will be used to execute the connected job multiple times
parallelMatrixProperties.nameTemplateHelp: Template for naming each execution. Available: $INDEX, $ITEM_VALUE
parallelMatrixProperties.additionalParamsHelp: Static parameters passed to all executions. Example:
parallelMatrixProperties.maxConcurrencyHelp: Leave empty for unlimited parallel execution
parallelMatrixProperties.failFastHelp: Stop all iterations if any iteration fails
parallelMatrixProperties.continueOnErrorHelp: Continue executing remaining items even if some fail
parallelMatrixProperties.step1: Connect an Array Parameter node to the Array Values input socket
parallelMatrixProperties.step2: Connect parallel execution node to the For Each Item execution socket
parallelMatrixProperties.step3: Connect the Iteration Value output to execution node inputs to access current item
parallelMatrixProperties.step4: Optionally connect Additional Parameters output for static parameters
parallelMatrixProperties.step5: Results are aggregated in the output sockets after all iterations complete

pipInstallProperties.requirementsHelp: Will be written to requirements.txt before installation
pipInstallProperties.existingFileWarning: Will use existing requirements.txt from working directory. Ensure file exists in repository or previous build step.

webhookProperties.configureWebhookDescription: Configure this webhook to allow external systems to trigger this workflow via HTTP requests.
webhookProperties.customEndpointHelp: Choose a unique endpoint name (letters, numbers, dashes, and underscores only). Examples:
webhookProperties.secretTokenHelp: Required for security. Include this token in the 'X-Webhook-Token' header when calling the webhook. Use the Generate button for a cryptographically secure 64-character token.
webhookProperties.secretTokenRequired: Secret token is required for webhook security
webhookProperties.activeHelp: Uncheck to temporarily disable this webhook trigger
webhookProperties.securityNoteText: Always configure a secret token for production webhooks. Git platforms will automatically sign requests using your secret.
webhookProperties.useCaseCicd: Trigger deployments from GitHub, GitLab, or other platforms
webhookProperties.useCaseNotifications: Respond to events from Slack, Discord, or monitoring tools
webhookProperties.useCaseApiIntegration: Process data from external APIs or services
webhookProperties.useCaseAutomation: Execute workflows when specific events occur

notificationProperties.notificationDescription: Send notifications via Email, Slack, or Webhook when this node executes.
notificationProperties.noTemplatesAvailable: No templates available for this notification type
notificationProperties.chooseTemplate: Choose a template to automatically fill the form fields below
notificationProperties.selectNotificationType: Select the type of notification to send
notificationProperties.attachBuildLogHelp: Email: Attaches log file • Slack: Uploads file (requires files:write scope) • Discord: Attaches file • Other webhooks: Use $BuildLog variable
notificationProperties.subject: Subject
notificationProperties.messageBodyHelp: Use $SocketName to reference input socket values
notificationProperties.sendAsHtmlHelp: Enable to send HTML formatted emails
notificationProperties.slackBotTokenHelp: Set SLACK_BOT_TOKEN environment variable to enable Slack notifications.
notificationProperties.slackWebhookTip: For Slack Incoming Webhooks, use the "Webhook" notification type instead.
notificationProperties.channelHelp: Specify the Slack channel (e.g., #general), or channel ID
notificationProperties.messageModeHelp: Block Kit enables rich, interactive messages with formatted layouts
notificationProperties.fallbackTextHelp: Fallback text when blocks cannot be displayed
notificationProperties.slackBlocksHelp: JSON array of Slack Block Kit blocks.
notificationProperties.webhookUrlHelp: Optional: Specify webhook URL here, or leave empty to use DISCORD_WEBHOOK_URL environment variable
notificationProperties.headersHelp: Optional HTTP headers as JSON object
notificationProperties.bodyHelp: Request body as JSON. Use $SocketName to reference input socket values.
notificationProperties.projectNameDesc: Name of the project being executed
notificationProperties.jobIdDesc: Unique identifier for this job execution
notificationProperties.statusDesc: Status text based on exit code (Success/Failed)
notificationProperties.exitCodeDesc: Exit code from previous execution (0 = success)
notificationProperties.failedNodeLabelDesc: Label of the node that failed (only on failure)
notificationProperties.willRetryDesc: Whether the job will retry after failure (Yes/No)
notificationProperties.buildLogDesc: Complete build log content (only when "Attach build log file" is enabled)
notificationProperties.buildLogPathDesc: Absolute path to build log file (only when "Attach build log file" is enabled)
notificationProperties.defaultEmailFromDesc: Default from address from system settings
notificationProperties.defaultEmailToDesc: Default to address from system settings
notificationProperties.variableUsageHelp: Use $VarName format in your notification messages. To reference output from connected nodes, use input socket variables like $INPUT_1, $INPUT_2, etc. All environment variables from System Settings are also available (e.g., $MY_ENV, $API_KEY).
notificationProperties.inputSocketsHelp: Use these variables to include data passed from connected nodes
notificationProperties.webhookWithBuildLog: Webhook with Build Log (when "Attach build log file" is enabled):
notificationProperties.discordWebhookNote: Note: Discord webhooks automatically attach the log file. For other webhooks, use $BuildLog to include log content in the JSON payload.
notificationProperties.smtpConfigurationHelp: Make sure your SMTP server settings are configured in the system environment variables or configuration file.
notificationProperties.requiredEnvironmentVariables: Required environment variables (or set them in system settings):
notificationProperties.webhookConfigurationHelp: Configure the HTTP method, headers, and body as required by your webhook service. Use context variables like $BuildNumber in the body.

admin.title: Administration
admin.subtitle: Manage system settings, users, and configuration

descriptions.brandName: The application name shown in the navigation header
descriptions.appLogo: Logo displayed next to the brand name (recommended: 32x32px PNG)
descriptions.adminEmail: Email address of the system administrator
descriptions.cronTimezone: Default timezone for all scheduled cron jobs
descriptions.sessionTimeout: How long user sessions remain active
descriptions.logLevel: Console logging verbosity level (error = least verbose, debug = most verbose)
descriptions.enableRegistration: Allow new users to register accounts
descriptions.smtpServer: SMTP server hostname for sending emails
descriptions.smtpUsername: SMTP authentication username (leave empty for unauthenticated servers like MailHog)
descriptions.smtpPassword: SMTP authentication password (leave empty for unauthenticated servers like MailHog)
descriptions.smtpSecure: Enable SSL/TLS encryption (use true for port 465, false for ports 25, 587, 1025)
descriptions.defaultEmailFrom: Default email address to send notifications from
descriptions.defaultEmailTo: Default email address to send notifications to (comma-separated for multiple)
descriptions.ldapEnabled: Enable LDAP/Active Directory authentication for users
descriptions.ldapUrl: LDAP server URL (e.g., ldap://domain.com:389 or ldaps://domain.com:636)
descriptions.ldapBindDn: Service account DN for LDAP binding (optional)
descriptions.ldapBindPassword: Service account password for LDAP binding (optional)
descriptions.ldapUserSearchBase: Base DN for user searches (e.g., ou=users,dc=domain,dc=com)
descriptions.ldapUserSearchFilter: LDAP filter for finding users. Use {username} placeholder (e.g., (mail={username}) or (sAMAccountName={username}))
descriptions.ldapAutoCreateUsers: Automatically create user accounts for successful LDAP authentications
descriptions.ldapDefaultRole: Default role assigned to new LDAP users
descriptions.ldapUseTls: Enable TLS encryption for LDAP connections
descriptions.ldapTlsCertificate: Upload CA certificate for TLS verification (optional)
descriptions.userGroups: JSON array of available user groups for access control

environmentVariables.title: Environment Variables
environmentVariables.subtitle: Manage server environment variables and secrets
environmentVariables.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this environment variable?
environmentVariables.isSecretHelp: Secret values will be hidden in the UI

credentialVault.title: Credential Vault
credentialVault.subtitle: Manage credentials for CI/CD workflows
credentialVault.name: Name
credentialVault.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this credential?
credentialVault.deleteWarning: This action cannot be undone. Projects using this credential may fail.

systemUpdates.title: System Updates
systemUpdates.subtitle: Manage application updates from GitHub releases
systemUpdates.clickToCheck: Click "Check for Updates" to see if a new version is available
systemUpdates.waitForBuilds: Wait for running builds to complete before updating
systemUpdates.waitForBuildsHelp: If unchecked, running builds will be paused and can resume after update

updateManagement.title: Update Management
updateManagement.waitForJobs: Wait for running jobs to complete before updating
updateManagement.alreadyLatest: You are running the latest version
updateManagement.updateInitiated: Update initiated. Server will restart shortly...
updateManagement.confirmUpdate: Are you sure you want to update to version {version}? The server will restart during this process.

agentUpdates.title: Agent Updates
agentUpdates.subtitle: Manage build agent versions and updates
agentUpdates.autoUpdateInfo: Agents with auto-update enabled will automatically download and install updates when available.

agentTemplates.title: Agent Templates
agentTemplates.subtitle: Manage remote agent update configurations
agentTemplates.updateTriggered: Update triggered for {name}. Agent will update and reconnect shortly.

notificationTemplates.title: Notification Templates
notificationTemplates.subtitle: Manage email, Slack, and webhook notification templates
notificationTemplates.createFirstTemplate: Create your first template to get started

groupManagement.title: Groups Management
groupManagement.subtitle: Manage user groups and LDAP mappings
groupManagement.name: Name
groupManagement.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this group?
groupManagement.deleteWarning: Users in this group will lose access to resources restricted to this group.
groupManagement.ldapMappingHelp: Map LDAP groups to this application group. Users who are members of any mapped LDAP group will automatically be added to this group.

table.title: Recent Builds
table.noBuildsYet: No builds have been executed yet.

deleteConfirm.title: Delete Build
deleteConfirm.message: Are you sure you want to delete build #{number}? This action cannot be undone.

logsModal.title: Build Logs - {buildId}...
logsModal.noLogs: No logs found for this build.

messages.checkStatusFailed: Failed to check current build status

banner.buildExecutingDescription: This project is currently running. Click "View Build" to monitor progress or cancel execution.
banner.projectDisabledDescription: Cron jobs will not run, manual execution is blocked, job triggers will not fire, and webhooks will be ignored. Click "Enable" to reactivate.

propertiesPanel.title: Node Properties
propertiesPanel.label: Label
propertiesPanel.labelHelp: This label is displayed on the node in the editor.
propertiesPanel.colorHelp: Choose a custom color for this node. The color picker shows a preview, or enter a hex color code.
propertiesPanel.inputSocketsHelp: Define input sockets for this node. Input sockets allow data to be passed into this node from upstream nodes.
propertiesPanel.agentRequired: Agent selection is required for execution nodes
propertiesPanel.agentHelp: This node will execute on the selected agent. Choose "Any available agent" if you don't have a preference.
propertiesPanel.workingDirectoryHelp: Directory where the script will execute. Relative to agent's workspace.
propertiesPanel.retryHelp: Configure retry behavior for this node if it fails during execution.
propertiesPanel.positionHelp: The X and Y coordinates of the node in the editor, if you are looking to fine-tune placement.
propertiesPanel.noNodeSelected: Select a node to view properties

cronTrigger.description: Schedule job execution with cron expressions

toast.retentionFailed: Failed to save retention settings. Please try again.

validation.missingAgent: 🚨 "{label}" has no executor selected. Agent selection is required to run.
validation.missingWebhookToken: "{label}" has no secret token. Secret tokens are required for webhook security.
